title.narrative: Partnership for the Development of Eastern Congo P-DEC

description.narrative: Focused in and around the Okapi Wildlife Reserve (OWR) and the Virunga National Park (VNP), as hubs of economic growth and security, P-DEC finds innovative ways to leverage, scale, and build on existing investments and successes to tackle long-standing issues and overcome mistrust and disenfranchisement through creative partnerships. By engaging local communities and institutions in both the diagnoses of and solutions to conflict drivers, P-DEC takes a resilience and systems strengthening approach, supporting communities to engage in inclusive multi-stakeholder mobilization and dialogue processes to design local conflict early warning systems, mitigation processes and alternatives to violence (Outcome 1), decision-making processes in governance structures and social accountability mechanisms (Outcome 2) and viable economic activities with a private sector that promotes stability, inter-ethnic cooperation and social cohesion (Outcome 3).

Through community mobilization and dialogue, communities will develop conflict identification, prevention and mitigation structures for dispute resolution (Outcome 1), prioritize public services for responsive delivery and increased accountability to foster peace (Outcome 2), and design sustainable green initiatives to improve stability through inclusive and diversified economic growth (Outcome 3)

We will leverage Mercy Corps’ global leadership in resilience programming and systems thinking, International Alert’s deep expertise in peacebuilding, conflict mitigation, and multi-level advocacy and the Wildlife Conservation Society’s role as the long-term formal stewards of OWR management. The Alliance for Responsible Mining, the International Peace Information Service, HIVE and the Fair Congo Foundation will add expertise on illicit trade and armed group dynamics, and legal, conflict-free and responsible mining practices. Our renowned local partners are all strongly connected with communities and local authorities and will continue engaging in conflict resolution and transformation processes beyond P-DEC. They include: APROHDIV and Justice Plus (prevention of youth recruitment into armed groups, reintegration of ex-combatants and access to education); SOFEPADI (empowering women’s voice in dialogue groups); CORACON (engaging a network of radio partners and journalists on conflict communications); and Pole Institute (ongoing political economy analyses).
